channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: President Biden 'absolutely not' withdrawing – White House
DR Congo soldiers sentenced to death for fleeing battle
item.description: In North Kivu, Democratic Republic of Congo, 25 soldiers were sentenced to death for fleeing Rwanda-backed M23 rebels and theft. They deserted positions, stole goods, and were detained with wives. One got a 10-year sentence. Lawyer Jules Muvweko will appeal. Army spokesman Reagan Mbuyi Kalonji noted internal military divisions. Eight officers were sentenced to death in May.

item.title: Britons vote in parliamentary election expected to propel Labour to power
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Beryl roars toward Mexico after leaving destruction in Jamaica and eastern Caribbean
Remains of missing 12-year-old child found after suspected crocodile attack
item.description: Australian police found remains of a 12-year-old attacked by a crocodile at Mango Creek, Palumpa during a holiday visit. Senior Sergeant Erica Gibson expressed sorrow. A black crocodile was seen. NT has over 100,000 crocodiles. A 2013 incident involved a 4.5-meter crocodile; in 2017, one man survived a non-fatal attack. Recently, a menacing crocodile was shot, cooked, and eaten.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Two-finger test: Doctor in Pakistan fired for performing banned virginity test on rape victim
item.description: In 2020, the LHC prohibited the use of the two-finger virginity test in rape examinations, deeming it "humiliating having no forensic value".​
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China warns of hotter, longer heatwaves as climate change intensifies
item.description: China's climate is rapidly changing, leading to hotter summers, heavier rains, and record temperatures. The China Meteorological Administration warns of significant temperature increases and more unpredictable weather patterns. The country faces challenges adapting to these changes, with potential for more extreme heat events and increased rainfall in the future.

item.title: California man guilty of stabbing gay student in 2018
item.description: Samuel Woodward, 26, was convicted of first-degree murder with a hate crime enhancement for the killing of University of Pennsylvania student Blaze Bernstein. The prosecution presented evidence linking Woodward to the crime, including his affiliation with a violent, anti-gay extremist group. The defense plans to appeal the ruling.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump keeps low profile while Joe Biden faces furor over candidacy
item.description: Former President Donald Trump has strategically minimized his public appearances following President Joe Biden's poor debate performance, allowing Democratic struggles to dominate the news cycle. By avoiding the spotlight and canceling planned events, Trump has allowed political pressure to mount on Biden, which has resulted in polls showing an increased lead for Trump both nationally and in swing states.

item.title: Grubbs fire: Northern California battles multiple wildfires, 26,000 evacuated
item.description: Evacuation orders for the Grubbs Fire in Palermo have been downgraded to warnings, impacting several zones in Butte County. The fire, igniting off Grubbs Road and Brollier Way, is part of a series of wildfires in Northern California, forcing 26,000 people to evacuate. The Thompson Fire near Oroville has grown significantly, while new fires have emerged, prompting further evacuations. A state of emergency has been declared, with federal funding approved to support firefighting efforts amid extreme heat and fire risk.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'We are all looking for path to win': Over 20 governors come to Biden's rescue amid calls for stepping down
item.description: White House Press Secretary Jean-Pierre affirms Biden's dedication to the campaign amid doubts from Democrats about his strategy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Man jailed for carrying 6-inch replica of iconic sword from Nintendo
item.description: A man in Nuneaton, Warwickshire, Anthony Bray, was sentenced to four months in prison for carrying a 6-inch Master Sword replica from Nintendo's The Legend of Zelda series. Despite claiming it was a fidget toy, he was arrested for carrying a bladed article. Bray received a four-month prison sentence and a victims' surcharge of £154.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Second American revolution if...': Right-wing think tank head says they are in the process of 'taking country back'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Beryl strikes Jamaica with intense winds and heavy rainfall
item.description: Hurricane Beryl, a powerful Category 4 storm, swept past Jamaica late on Wednesday, bringing intense winds and heavy rainfall. The storm had previously caused significant damage and claimed at least seven lives in the southeastern Caribbean.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US President Joe Biden acknowledges 'critical days' to save candidacy
item.description: US President Joe Biden acknowledges the importance of the coming days for his re-election campaign after a poor debate performance. Despite pressure from allies and donors to step down, he remains determined to stay in the race. Biden plans to reassure voters with upcoming appearances and interviews, amidst internal concerns about his viability and age. A new poll shows Trump leading Biden by 6 points among likely voters.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Muslims are wary of Far-Right win in French polls
item.description: Marine Le Pen's RN came out well ahead in Sunday's first-round vote after President Emmanuel Macron's gamble on a snap election backfired, leaving his centrist camp in a lowly third place behind the RN and a hastily formed left-wing alliance. Pollsters calculated the first round put the RN on track for anything between 250-300 seats. But that was before the tactical withdrawals and cross-party calls for voters to back whichever candidate was best placed to defeat the local RN rival.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hamas says it has sent new 'ideas' on halting Israel war
'If Biden is awake': White House briefing turns into debate on President's cold, nap time. Watch
item.description: "Have you ever got a cold," White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre asked a correspondent Wednesday during the White House briefing on a question over how President was wobbly during the debate for which his cold was blamed and was fit the next day at the campaign. White House said they did not reveal the information about the cold ahead of the debate as they did not want to use it.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden, Kamala Harris' joint rare appearance, pep talk amid doubt over ticket
item.description: ​Biden convened the meeting with Kamala Harris and a group of influential Democratic governors amid speculations that he may announce his decision to drop out of the re-election bid. But the meeting was like a pep talk confirming that Kamala Harris was not going to take Biden's place and Biden was not mulling to opt out either.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vivek Ramaswamy has this advice for Democrats on 'which puppet to choose'
item.description: ​Vivek Ramaswamy, who is being seen as the Republican's VP candidate, offered a piece of advice with a banter to the Democrats as speculations are rife over Biden alternatives. The Indian-American billionaire said the more the Democrats delay choosing their 'puppet', it's best for them -- contrary to the popular belief as there will be a honeymoon period after a new candidate is picked. The Democrats' ideal situation would be the election to be held during that honeymoon period sans public scrutiny, Vivek Ramaswamy said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
